author: cnbc.com
title: Lisa Lee joins Trident Capital Cybersecurity as Chief Financial Officer
text:
SAN MATEO, Calif., March 7, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- Trident Capital Cybersecurity, a leading venture capital firm investing exclusively in cybersecurity, today announced the appointment of Lisa Lee as Chief Financial Officer (CFO).
Lee spent the past 20 years as a senior financial executive in leading venture capital firms. Most recently, Lee was the Chief Financial Officer of Firelake Capital Management, a venture capital firm based in San Francisco investing in early stage energy and clean technology companies. Previously, she was the Controller of Walden International, a US based venture capital firm focused on cross-border investments that leverage global markets and talent to grow industry-leading companies.
"We are very pleased to add Lisa to our team as we continue to build our investment franchise," said J. Alberto Yépez, Co-Founder and Managing Director of Trident Cybersecurity. "She has an excellent reputation as an accomplished financial executive with significant expertise in venture capital finance and fund management. Her acumen and insights are integral to our growth and continued expansion."
"Having been intimately involved in the venture industry for more than two decades, I have great admiration for the unique franchise the team at Trident Cybersecurity is building," said Lisa Lee. "Greater cybersecurity will enable economic growth and prosperity. I'm very excited to join the firm at an obvious inflection point in its growth."
Lee holds a bachelor's degree in accounting from Golden Gate University in San Francisco.
About Trident Capital Cybersecurity
Trident Capital Cybersecurity is a $300 million fund exclusively investing in cybersecurity companies. The firm brings deep industry expertise and a strong network of relationships. Trident's 50-person Cybersecurity Advisory Council includes industry CEOs, security entrepreneurs, senior information security executives, and former government security leaders. Portfolio companies include 4iQ, Attivo, Appthority, Bayshore Networks, BehavioSec, ID Experts, IronNet Cybersecurity, Prevoty, and ReversingLabs. Trident's principals have been investing in cybersecurity since 1998 and have made a total of 34 cybersecurity investments. For more information, please visit www.tridentcyber.com .
